intro: Sitobolium punctilobum, commonly known as the spotted leaf herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves with distinctive punctate markings. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
